H0.text: What common chemical compound type, including many natural fats and essential oils, results from replacing the hydrogen of an acid by an alkyl or other organic group. Ester-like compound

H1.text: What common chemical compound type, including many natural fats and essential oils, results from replacing the hydrogen of an acid by an alkyl or other organic group. Amide

H2.text: What common chemical compound type, including many natural fats and essential oils, results from replacing the hydrogen of an acid by an alkyl or other organic group. Ether

H3.text: What common chemical compound type, including many natural fats and essential oils, results from replacing the hydrogen of an acid by an alkyl or other organic group. COOR

A4.text: Esters are formed by replacing the hydrogen of a carboxylic acid with an organyl group (R').

A5.text: Esters are commonly represented by the formula RCOOR', where R and R' are organyl groups.
